message.content:
cs.CR, cs.AR, cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.SY

This paper discusses a security vulnerability in processors that utilize lazy FPU context switching, which is a topic related to computer security (cs.CR). The attack described in the paper exploits microarchitectural side channels, which falls under the category of computer architecture (cs.AR). The paper also discusses the impact of this vulnerability on operating systems, which is related to software engineering (cs.SE) and programming languages (cs.PL). Finally, the paper discusses the need to turn off lazy FPU context switching, which is related to system security (cs.SY).
